Option D. Hyperplastic polyp: Generally benign and more common in adults, hyperplastic polyps are typically located in the distal colon and rectum and are not associated with intussusception or multiple polyps in children.

 

Educational Objective:

 

 

Ref: Robbins and Cotrans pathologic basis of disease 8th edition pg 1557

questions.text:
You are posted as an intern in casualty. An elderly 60-year-old man is brought to you with complaints of chest pain. He has tested positive for COVID. Which of the following features will prompt you to get this patient admitted to dedicated COVID health centre? (INICET NOV 2020)

 

A. Respiratory rate of 25/min

B. SpO2 93%

C. Multiple comorbidities

D. Age
questions.solution:
Ans. B) A, B, C & D only

 

A & B Respiratory rate of 25/min and SpO2 93% : Both of these values are indicative of potential respiratory compromise, which is concerning in a COVID-19 patient. These values suggest the need for closer monitoring and possible oxygen supplementation.

 

C. Multiple comorbidities: Patients with multiple comorbidities are at a higher risk of severe disease and complications from COVID-19, warranting admission for close monitoring and treatment.

 

D. Age: Age is a known risk factor for severity and complications in COVID-19. Older patients, like the 60-year-old man in the scenario, generally have poorer outcomes and may benefit from hospital care.

 

Educational Objective:

 

When evaluating a COVID-19 patient for hospital admission, consider clinical signs of respiratory distress, overall oxygen saturation, presence of comorbidities, and age due to their significant impacts on disease severity and outcome.

choices.text: Drug A decreases intestinal absorption of Drug B
﻿﻿﻿Drug A reduces first pass metabolism of Drug B
﻿﻿﻿Drug A increases the metabolism of Drug B
Drug A increases renal elimination of Drug B

questions.text: The table below gives the AUC of drug B alone and that of drug B when combined with another drug A. If the p value is <0.01, then which of the following statements is true? (INICET 2021)
questions.solution:
Ans. B. Drug A reduces first pass metabolism of Drug B
 

  • The area under the curve or AUC in plasma concentration vs time graph can be used as a measure of the bioavailability of a drug. The bioavailability of a given drug refers to the fraction of the given dose which reaches the systemic circulation. The greater the area under the curve or AUC, the greater is the bioavailability.
  • From the given data, it is seen that the AUC for Drug B is less than the AUC for Drug A + Drug B. And the p value <0.01 indicates that the data is statistically significant. (As the p value is <0.05)
  • So, it can be inferred that the Drug A increases the bioavailability of drug B.

 

As bioavailability depends on two factors:

 

  • Absorption (Bioavailability is directly proportional to the rate of drug absorption)
  • First Pass Metabolism (Bioavailability is inversely proportional to the rate of first pass metabolism of the drug)
  • Therefore, it can be assumed that drug B either increase the absorption or decrease the first pass metabolism of drug A.
  • So among the given options, best answer seem to be option B: Drug A reduces the first pass metabolism of drug B

 

Other Options:

 

Option A. Drug A decreases intestinal absorption of Drug B: This statement is incorrect. If Drug A decreased the intestinal absorption of Drug B, the AUC would be lower when the drugs are combined, not higher.

 

Option C. Drug A increases the metabolism of Drug B: This statement is incorrect. If Drug A increased the metabolism of Drug B, the AUC would be lower when the drugs are combined.

 

Option D. Drug A increases renal elimination of Drug B: This statement is incorrect. If Drug A increased the renal elimination of Drug B, it would lead to a decrease in AUC, not an increase.

 

Educational Objective:

 

The increase in the AUC of Drug B when combined with Drug A, with a statistically significant p value, indicates that Drug A reduces the first pass metabolism of Drug B, thereby increasing its bioavailability.
